Managing a team of Product Managers who are experimenting with bold new ideas that push the boundary of what's possible @ Instagram. The team's charter is to help Instagram's 600M consumers discover, engage and transact with businesses they love on Instagram. On 11/1, we announced the start of our journey for shopping on Instagram- http://www.recode.net/2016/11/1/13478838/instagram-shopping-commerce-brands-discovering- https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2016-11-01/instagram-wants-to-ease-its-users-into-shoppingSome of the stuff that is already live includes - brand new user experiences that connect Instagram's 600M MAUs to the businesses they love. Previously, lead the monetization efforts (carousel ads, direct response ads etc.)I am hiring - so reach out if you are interested in working at Instagram!
Manager, Product Management - New Experiences @ Instagram

During my stay at Yahoo, I lead the efforts for two products:1) Yahoo Today - an intelligent personal assistance designed for your mobile phoneIn the world of mobile, the user's context "is the query". By taking user's location, habits and past history, we can build a personal assistant that provides the right information at the right time based on the context.Yahoo Today allows you to track real time weather, be notified about your favorite team games, track your stock portfolio, be notified about flight statuses, receive updates on Amazon packages - and much more. See attached screenshots for more details.I conceived, designed and prototyped a brand new product idea and got the leadership excited about pursuing my vision. I grew this product from just an idea to a well established product line with several engineers/PMs/designers working full time on making it the best personal assistance in town.Here is some press coverage:-  http://www.theverge.com/2014/4/29/5665308/yahoo-mail-app-for-iphone-updated-with-news-and-a-google-now-rival-  http://mashable.com/2014/04/29/yahoo-mail-app-redesign/?utm_cid=mash-com-Tw-tech-link2) Mobile MonetizationI lead the team responsible for building out the mobile monetization strategy, product and operations for Yahoo's mobile apps. Ideated, designed and built the marketplace for mobile app install ads for Yahoo - see screenshots attached here.These products generate revenue in excess of a billion dollars and are responsible for setting the stage for continued revenue growth on mobile.Previously, a Lead Product Manager on the same team.
PM, Growth for Hotmail Mobile (now Outlook.com)

Worked as a Growth PM for Hotmail (now Outlook.com), the world's largest email service with 350 Million+ users. As part of this role, I lead:1) Grew mobile user base by 100% YoYMy philosophy has been that growth comes not from the top 10% of users, but from those less engaged users who are churning or becoming inactive every day.Reduced friction in mobile account sign up - went from 15 fields to just 6 and saw a spike in user registration by 60%. I worked hard to identify top reasons for churn - looked and analyzed customer support calls, comments on blogosphere etc. Executed strategies that helped reverse the tide.2) Grew international user base (in key markets like Japan) by 300% YoYI also managed a team of PMs in Japan responsible for a separate version of Hotmail for the Japanese markets (a top market for Microsoft) optimized for DoCoMo and other players. I was also responsible for managed relationships with mobile phone manufacturers (like RIM, Samsung, Nokia etc.) and mobile operators. I participated in partnership discussions, identified product customization for each carrier and partner for co-branding and white-labeling (wap-deck, back-linking).3)  Grew desktop revenue by 80% YoYI was responsible for leading a global roll out of Bing Product Ads in Hotmail’s Desktop Site. I designed the first A/B testing framework and approach for testing Ads in Hotmail. I piloted a brand new Ad product (Bing Product Search Ads) that targets ads based on what’s in the user’s email content. This product grew to be highly successful generating >US$500 million a year.

Wore multiple hats and spent time in different organizations within Microsoft. One of the best experiences of my career traveling and working in different countries. ++ Spent time with the database team (SQL Server) as a Lead Engineer at Microsoft's Charlotte, NC office. Post-sales engineering implementation lead/manager for Microsoft SQL Server for enterprise customers (Bank Of America, Verizon etc.). This was from Sep 2005 to May 2007.++ Spent time in Microsoft Bangalore office as a Manager, Technology Consultancy. Led a team of 25+ employees who provided pre-sales technical consultation to Microsoft’s Independent Software Vendors. This was from September 2003 to 2005.++ Wrote several technical articles (see links in the publication section below).

I have had the pleasure of working with Sanchan at Yahoo in different components of the Mobile SDK. Sanchan is among the sharpest of the Product Managers I have worked with in my career. He has an exceptional ability to quickly grasp the complex issues; come up with creative solutions and articulate it very crisply. Sanchan is very focused and result oriented; and can always be counted upon to ‘make it happen’. He stamped his footprint (in a positive way) in almost every area he owned. Sanchan’s impact on Yahoo Mobile SDK was very huge and made a big difference to what the engineering team delivered. Sanchan is a tremendous asset to any organization and I recommend him very highly.

Jesse and I work together at Yahoo - he was my counterpart on engineering where we built the foundation of Yahoo's mobile ad tech. I was involved in identification, due diligence and post acquisition integration of Jesse startup into Yahoo's overall vision and technology space. Since the day I met him, I was amazed at Jesse's unique traits and abilities - a super compelling vision of the mobile ad tech space (years ahead of what others in the industry were talking about), an entrepreneurial grit to push through obstacles and the technical chops to make that vision a reality. He is very well respected by his team and his peers - and is a super networker/recruiter. His rolodex helped us expand the team very quickly and deliver on ambitious goals. I hope that our paths cross again in the future - and I wish him great success in his endeavors.

September 5, 2013, Sanchan S reported directly to Drew

Drew exemplifies "leadership by action" rather than "by title".  He is a true team leader who motivates his team and his peers to constantly think outside the box and deliver outstanding business results. Over the years, he has tackled several big business challenges for the company and has shipped several innovative products that span the breadth of the company and deliver a "OneYahoo" experience for our users. Drew is very passionate about what he does.  One of the things that Drew epitomizes is a learning mindset. He is constantly on the lookout for new things to learn and improve on. He is very data driven (rather than opinion driven). He creates a culture where everybody on the team can voice their own ideas and challenge existing ideas. Everybody loves to work with and for him. I hope our paths cross again sometime in the near future.

summary: I am passionate about bringing ideas to life and building innovative products. I am obsessed with user focused design and strongly believe that "easier is better than better". I enjoy prototyping new ideas and securing funding to turn them into strategic products for the company - have successfully taken ideas to v1 launches within multi-national corporations. I have a proven track record of taking startups from ideation to funding to launch. Leading and motivating teams to produce extraordinary results - that's my forte. Everyone gives in their 100% but the key to success is to have them give that 1% more.I am passionate about product management and everything tech. If you have questions on product management, I have opinions to share. I am active on several forums - follow me:- Twitter - https://twitter.com/sanchans- Quora - http://www.quora.com/Sanchan-Saxena- Slideshare - http://www.slideshare.net/sanchan_saxena
